I have my gripes with this game.
You can have a fun match or have a terrible time, there is a middle ground but these matches are rare. 
From the time I've played i have done killer and survivor, and i can securely tell you form my perspective that both of these can be rather aggravating. 

Yet... this game haves something that keeps me coming back for more.
Whether its looping the killer or downing that one survivor with a key, i just keep coming back.

Funny enough after a long hiatus as per recommended by Mathieu Cote with his infamous line: 
"Play something else for a week, try Civilization or something"

I did just that and took a long break from the game skipping even before the announcement of the All-Kill Chapter. Since then I've decided to slowly come back with a clear mind.

I don't think I'll be playing survivor any time soon until the Resident Evil chapter comes out, playing survivor is the reason why i ended up getting burnt out, but I've always enjoyed playing killer, from being a friendly Boop the snoot Piggy to punishing the souls of the dammed with Pyramid Head/Executioner.

Even tough i have have some gripes with both sides of survivors and killers, i can still gladly recommend this game to any one who hasn't given it a try because at the end of the day its a pretty solid game and a breath of fresh entity air for some one new. 

If you're curious about it and still haven't jumped in on the resident evil band wagon i do recommend you get your self a copy, don't take the game to serious ignore the ranking system and just have a blast.

"I think We've done a pretty good job so far" -Mathieu Cote

Mathieu please never stop being a meme. 

Thanks for reading all my nonsense hope to see you in the fog. :)

Dead by Daylight é um jogo bem divertido, um dos melhores do seu gênero e bom pra jogar algo que não seja fps. Se você quiser jogar com personagens que não são os padrões vai ter que ou jogar muito pra comprar com pontos ou comprar as dlc's, mas que principalmente em promoções valem a pena. O jogo tem seus problemas sim e algumas coisas ainda são desbalanceadas mas vale bastante a pena comprar porque o jogo está ficando cada vez melhor.
Is it balanced? No, not at all. But it is pretty fun usually, at least at lower ranks.

Un bon jeu de coopération entre amis de préférences pour la partie survivant et solo pour la partie tueur .
Incarner un tueur de licence ou de film, incarner le méchant dans un jeu c'est très satisfaisant pour l'immersion . Le gros bémol reste la communauté qui est toxique sur plusieurs aspects ( tueur camper /tunnel ) et qui n'aide pas à te surpasser dans une game mais bien à t'enfoncer si le matchmacking est déséquilibré .
Il manque une séparation entre une file tryhard et une file détente/ match normal pour tester des nouvelles mécaniques ...

기록상 20시간인 거 존나 꼴받음.
20시간 중 10시간은 친구 빌려준 거, 5시간은 친죽, 3시간은 매칭, 2시간이 게임임. 실제 플레이 시간이 기록의 10%인 환장의 겜
근데 재미는 있음. 공포겜이라면서 몇 분만 해도 좆도 안 무서움을 알 수 있음. 갑툭튀에 조금 놀랄 수는 있는데 그 이상은 아님.
정가로 샀는데 몇 년동안 실 플레이는 2시간밖에 안 했음에도 불구하고 돈 아깝다는 생각은 안 함. 걍 아 이겜 라이브러리에 묵힌지 한참 됐는데... 이제 할 때도 됐는데... 싶을 뿐임. 
늅뉴비는 들이박지 말고 유튜버 스트리머들 고인물 많으니까 거기서 적응하고 오면 더 나을듯
그렇다고 나도 스트리머처럼 할 수 있을 거란 희망은 가지지 말고
아무튼... 어케 끝맺냐
대충 재밌는 겜이에요 근데 세일할때 사시면 더 좋음 ㅊㅊ

I absolutely loved this game when I started playing.
Now I hate it.

In this game, when playing as Survivor, you go up against a Killer who can select from an aray of killers, killer add-ons and perks. None of wich you know beforehand or even during the game. This means that every match is a lottery: either you get a challenging match (with 50% chance of winning) or you get your fun ruined by an OP killer / OP add-ons / OP perks / a combo of all these. Losing a game when your opponent is skilled can be frustratring, but losing a game because the developers put in these horribilities is maddening.

I am ashamed to have played this game for so long and to even spent extra money on it.

Don't buy this game, unless they get rid of pink add-ons and killers like the Ghostface and the Cannibal.

Играя в эту игру вы становитесь задротом и не ботаете. Если у вас цели получить 100 к на всеросе, а может даже 300 или 500, то не советую. Покупая это творение вы принимаете, что вам придется играть по 2 часа  в день минимум, чтобы играть нормально. Если вы перестаёте играть в дбд на несколько дней, то вы автоматически становитесь лохом. Вот почему я рекомендую к покупке данную игру, ведь мне не нужны конкуренты на всеросе.

I fucking love DBD, and I 100% recommend playing it at least once, just for the experience.

There is one KEY STATEMENT I'd like to make about this game, for any potential new players:
 Dead By Daylight is an ASYMMETRICAL game, and there are many different combinations of circumstances in each match. Even if you play perfectly, you still might get screwed over by an ill-mannered killer or an ignorant teammate. Approach this game with a learning mindset, and remember that nothing is guaranteed in your favor, and I think you'll have an amazing time playing. I've played this game for over a year, and I've always loved trying crazy dumb shit and seeing what I can get away with. I've had so much fun because Dead By Daylight is like a test of my ability to improvise, and every match is different. Every killer is different, and your teammates will usually be different. There are so many things that could go wrong, go right, go POPPIN OFF. So if you're comfortable adopting a flexible mindset and flexible style of gameplay, you can get a ton of awesome value out of this game.

 I have definitely been frustrated with the developers (BHVR) in terms of some of the decisions they've made for the game, because I feel like they truly don't listen to the credible players when they're asking their playerbase for feedback. There are so many dedicated DBD players that have great ideas for improving the game, but BHVR instead focuses on releasing new content like clockwork every three months, and continues to build their empire on top of their buggy coding, leaving player concerns unresolved and creating new bugs in-game every time a patch comes out. I think DBD could really benefit from slowing down on the content production, and just fine-tuning everything. With each new DLC release, it just feels like they're selling out more and more and letting the real concerns of the playerbase fall to the wayside. Hopefully BHVR will improve, and realize that the DBD community is the most valuable resource that they have in truly understanding their own game. I question the longevity of this game because of its developers. I really feel like this game could be infinitely replayable, but all the bullshit bugs and errors with hit registration and map glitches definitely encourage people to uninstall on an increasingly frequent basis. 

If you can improvise, not take shit personally, and learn to laugh at all your fuck-ups (cause you're gonna be fucking up a lot for a while, it's just a part of the learning process), then you can really spend some worthwhile time playing DBD. Stay open-minded about everything, even when you're pissed off. It helps you improve. This game is super fucking cool because it helps you train your mind to focus on immediate survival while you've got the terrifying sounds of the killer closing in all around you. It's usually not something that new players can do at first. It's normal to be totally scared of this game at first, especially if you're playing survivor. But if you wanna test your courage and just have fun, despite whatever may happen, then totally buy this game. 

I've played this game for over 1,000 hours, and mostly on Survivor. I genuinely feel that playing so much Survivor has helped me cope with parts of my PTSD. My PTSD emerged from an experience where I felt completely powerless at the hands of my attacker, and DBD has helped me start to work through that. Survivors don't seem like they have any defenses against killers at all, but once you spend more time playing and learning, you can really empower yourself as a survivor. Learning to play more aggressively, and to do more risky things, and to succeed more and more often (but never all the time) has definitely helped mend the awful feelings of helplessness I used to experience when I first started playing this game. Playing DBD has helped me more easily UNFREEZE out of my fight-or-flight reactions to things that trigger my PTSD. By getting better, I've become more confident, because I'm able to give a killer a run for their money, and that's all I wanna do. I just wanna do some spicy moves and play the equivalent of intensely, tight-butthole-fast mental chess games, just to see what I can achieve. And that's why I still play DBD. I still wanna get better at the game; I wanna learn all the things I'm missing at this stage in my understanding of it. And even after 1,000 hours in, I'm still observing the behavior of other players and testing new strats and learning unexpected things on a regular basis. The game is literally like a life or death social simulator. Some of your friends will come in clutch, and others will misplay so horribly that the embarrassment fuckin hurts. Just go with the flow, and if it's only shit flowin by, then keep your head up in that shit river. Don't have expectations for how matches will go. Anything can happen. If your teammates hard-throw and you're sacrificed on first hook, then just accept that this is a Shit Match, Shit Matches Happen, and You Ain't Goan Drown on Shit River. Just float on down that shit river and find yourself a new match, and try to OBSERVE the gameplay instead of judging it. 

In summation: yeah, buy this game unless you come unhinged at the perceived fundamental incompetence of game developers. Talking about balancing this game is pointless. It'll never be balanced. It'll always be a shitshow. If you aren't on board with that, then save your money. But if you wanna try something new, then definitely go for it. DBD has changed my life in many ways, and has largely been a positive influence on my life.

Dead By Daylight, anuncio mi retiro de forma permanente.

¿Razones? La nueva actualizacion es una basura, "nerfeearon" todas las Perks para "BIEN", ¿Necesidad de nerfear escalofrio? ¿Necesidad de nerfear tiempo prestado? la verdad que el juego me encantaba y le dedicaba todo mi tiempo libre e incluso le e metido dinero. Me da mucha tristeza dejar el juego, pero la verdad que no hicieron nada para bien, me siento como si estuviera jugando un nuevo juego con la nueva actualizacion, la verdad me decepciono bastante. Si alguien que se lo va a comprar quiza se puede acostumbrar a la actualizacion de las nuevas Perks, pero la verdad que alguien que juega hace tiempo y recibir esta horrible actualizacion del juego es decepcionante, me retiro y  no pienso volver.

PD: No puedo abandonar este juego, siento que es algo de mi que no puedo abandonar, creo que me tendre que adaptar a la nueva actualizacion de las perks y ya :(
